name: Ian's Letter
desc:
This letter was written yesterday by your brother, Ian.

"To my family and friends,

I have recovered well enough to leave this place and find my companions.  The Elder Elves, here in Lorenwaite, think I still need time to heal, but every day that goes by is a day that my friends may not survive.  I must try and find them.  I will return to Brinsby shortly, hopefully with our friends.

Ian"

name: Kendra's Ring
desc: Ring made of solid gold. It has Kendra's family name engraved on the side of the band.

name: Letter to the kobold king
desc:
This letter appears to have been written recently.

"...You have delayed long enough.  The time for you to carry out your orders is now.  I will be sending one of my loyal servants to give further instructions once you have completed the task at hand.

Z..."

name: Vial of Poison

name: Eris's Letter
desc: The letter Eris had posted on the door of their hut for Nnenne.

name: Forged Minister's Letter
desc: This letter, addressed to Princess Zidae, falsely claimed that King Setus II was sick but alive and on his way to Wan. Ambassador Astimund wrote it to replace the message bearing news of the king's death. He surreptitiously used the minister's own seal and blue wax to seal it. The young witch was supposed to find the messenger carrying the genuine letter and somehow replace it.

name: Forged Princess's Letter
desc: This letter, addressed to the Minister of Peace in Enzibar, was signed Princess Zidae. It expressed sorrow at the king's death and gratitude to the minister for sending the news. It then directed him to continue the diplomatic mission to Wan. It was actually written by Ambassador Astimund, who sealed it using the royal seal in the dead king's tent. The young witch was supposed to find a messenger to deliver it to the mansion of the High Mayor of Enzibar.

name: Goose-Fletched Arrow
desc: The arrow that killed Nnenne.

desc: A flower found in a field.

name: Key of Dross

name: Lodestone
desc:
Bauble

The young witch took this lodestone from the skeleton of Tilen. It was hot to the touch when Tilen's ghost appeared, but it is now quite cool.

name: Map of the Woods
desc:
As you explore, you'll discover new landmarks. Each landmark is added to this map.

You can use the map to fast travel to these locations. This is always quicker than getting there by foot, but still takes some time -- less if the young witch knows the lore of Woodcraft.

Using the map strategically is key to a successful adventure. Every new day begins at the witches' house, so the more landmarks you find, the more efficiently you can explore the woods.

name: Crow
desc:
Pharaoh, a crow of glossy black, was the young witch's familiar, companion, and would-be advisor. He was fond of kernels, blood, and carrion and possessive of his human's company.

Soporific Crow's Curse: Target suffers -4 AC, -4 Fortitude, -4 Reflex, and -4 Will for 1 round. In addition, the target has a base 70% chance of being immobilized for 2 rounds (Will modifies).

name: Sickle of Minor Advantage
desc: Once, the forges of Jad Bizunta ran hot day and night with the production of weapons. The magi folded their strange, appalling magic into the metal, and the leaders of the city all but gave away whole armories to bolster the defense of the lands pillaged by the Three Warlike Governors during Wan’s Incursion Wars. Though most of these weapons ended up in state armories or as treasured heirlooms, this sickle--likely the possession of a peasant who would be able to use it in their own field after it saw service on the king’s--ended up in Eldest Lady’s backyard.
